items.q: Who was the primary architect of the mass extermination program during the Holocaust?
items.explanation: As head of the SS, Himmler was a leading member of the Nazi Party and deeply responsible for the Holocaust.

items.q: The Industrial Revolution began in the United States.
items.explanation: It began in Great Britain in the late 18th century.

items.q: Joan of Arc fought in the Hundred Years' War.
items.explanation: She led the French army to several important victories against the English.

items.q: What historical event in 1914 sparked the beginning of World War I?
items.a: The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand
items.explanation: He was the heir to the Austro-Hungarian throne, killed in Sarajevo.

items.q: Which US president is associated with the 'New Deal' programs?
items.explanation: They were designed to provide relief during the Great Depression.

items.q: What European empire was ruled by the Habsburg family for centuries?
items.a: The Holy Roman Empire (or the Austro-Hungarian Empire)
items.explanation: The Habsburgs were one of the most prominent royal houses of Europe.

items.q: Who was the famous military leader who crowned himself Emperor of the French in 1804?
items.explanation: He built a massive empire across Europe before his eventual defeat.

items.q: What massive conflict in the US began with the attack on Fort Sumter?
items.explanation: Confederate forces bombarded the US fort in South Carolina.

items.q: What Chinese philosophical system emphasizes piety, social harmony, and respect for elders?
items.explanation: It deeply influenced Chinese culture and government for millennia.

items.q: What was the code name for the US project to develop the first atomic bomb?
items.explanation: It was led by J. Robert Oppenheimer.
